newsitem.title: USA: Princess Diana arrives for Washington fund-raiser.
newsitem.headline: Princess Diana arrives for Washington fund-raiser.

text.p: Britain's Princess Diana, newly divorced from heir to the throne Prince Charles, arrived in Washington on Monday ahead of a White House fund-raising breakfast for breast cancer research on Tuesday.

Diana arrived at Dulles International Airport late on Monday and headed to the Brazilian Embassy, where she will be staying with her friend, Lucia Flecha de Lima, wife of the Brazilian ambassador to the United States.
She will be first lady Hillary Clinton's guest at the White House breakfast, along with 120 Washington socialites and popular fashion designers.

She is scheduled to attend a lunch at the British embassy and will serve as honorary chair of a $500-a-person gala evening on Tuesday night in aid of the Nina Hyde Breast Cancer Fund, named after the fashion editor at the Washington Post who died of breast cancer in 1990.

Local television stations reported that Diana flew on the Concorde from London to New York, travelling on to Washington aboard the private jet of Katharine Graham, the retired publisher of the Washington Post.
